intro: Rubus canadensis var. septemfoliolatus, commonly known as the seven-leaf blackberry, is a variant of the Canadian blackberry species. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, typically featuring seven leaflets. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are usually dark purple to black when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and thickets. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in local ecosystems.
